name: Hotel Rathaus Wein & Design

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel. The breakfast is unbelievable -- every kind of meat, cheese, pastry, cereal, and yogurt you could imagine. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff was very friendly and spoke great English. We couldn't recommend this place more highly.
reviews.title: A great hotel -- great service, great staff, delicious breakfast
Cozy Wine hotel
reviews.text: This hotel was so cozy and friendly. Close to the museum quarter and center of town, clean and un-cluttered rooms, friendly staff. They had a wine theme, so each room was sponsored by an Austrian vintner, plus a wine bar at the lobby level. Would definitely stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Contemporary rooms of a decent size. Its a great hotel for wine lovers. The service was friendly and down to earth. Hotel location is very central to some great attractions.
reviews.title: Great for wine lovers

reviews.text: Great stay and will definitely be back when in Vienna.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel! Fabulous rooms...

reviews.text: Loved this hotel! Fabulous rooms, fabulous building, perfect location, lovely breakfast, helpful staff and the Shower is amazing! We will defo stay here again!
reviews.title: Will definately come back here again !

reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights at this 6 year old boutique hotel. We chose it in view of the strong and positive comments on TA. I booked a large suite on the top floor. The suite was HUGE! The ceiling was very tall with skylight windows. The bed was a little disappointingly small. Toilets / shower was excellent and the heated floor in the toilet and shower areas were a nice touch of luxury, especially in a cold winter.
reviews.title: Lovely boutique hotel thats a little off from the hustle and bustle of Vienna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was excellent with a huge selection of cold cuts and fruits and juices etc. It is however, essentially a "European" breakfast with only cooked eggs (on order).
reviews.title: Perfect base for meeting Vienna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My main disappointment was the erratic heating in the Suite, which could be much improved.
reviews.title: Fantastic staff exceeded only by an incredible breakfast buffet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front reception desk staff were most helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel!

reviews.text: The hotel is located in a somewhat quiet area of the city, though the bus and tram and underground stations are not more than 10 - 15 minutes away by foot.
reviews.title: Chic!

reviews.text: We booked following rave reviews on TA and even then the hotel beat our (high) expectations. Impeccably decorated rooms- well stocked toiletries, great bathrooms, and as everyone says the breakfast is quite superb. Check it out if only to see the 30 plus different jam pots with spoons all aligned at the same angle! Whilst they don't do food, we had a pleasant bottle of wine (or three) in the courtyard, and would recommend the "wine plate" of anti pasti- again beautifully presented and more than enough if you'd been eating out all day. Great location, really close to the sights and staff super. Would deffo return, and also try out their sister hotel in Salzburg.
reviews.title: Simply superb- THE best place to stay in Vienna

reviews.text: We stayed at Rathaus for 5 nights in August. It is a beautiful and comfortable hotel. Fine modern decor. But, the breakfast was one of the best I have been served ever. I would truly recomend to have breakfast at the hotel even if you lodge somewhere else.
reviews.title: Over the Top Breakfast

reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Rathaus. I was concerned that it would not live up to the reviews/online description but it did. The service was excellent with warm and helpful staff--available 24 hours--who seemed to think a step ahead of you to make your stay comfortable and easy from local recommendations to providing train tickets to arranging airport transfers. I was very happy with my room--spacious, well-lit with large windows, very well air-conditioned during a quite hot summer week, and of modern design. Importantly, the room was also very quiet helping me quickly get over jet lag. The wine bar in the evenings is a lovely space to wind down at the end of the day while sampling local wine and the breakfast spread is really wonderful as others have described. The lounge also has a great collection of tour books for guests to use. I was traveling for business but the location is ideal for both work (close to many different subway lines) and for leisure (short walking distance to the museums and a pleasant 15 min stroll to the city centre monuments).
reviews.title: stylish and comfortable boutique hotel in vienna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would look forward to staying here again.
reviews.title: Loved this top hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just getting ready to check out of this fantastic hotel..
reviews.title: Great hotel with excellent staff

reviews.text: - very quiet and comfortable room overlooking the courtyard.
reviews.title: great service, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - service we experienced as excellent: all our questions are requests were replied promptly, efficiently an with a smile. the girls give you the impression that you are a valuable customer and not just a tourist passing by
reviews.title: Exceptional Service

reviews.text: - beds and pillows: good quality
reviews.title: Great Value, Great Services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - A/C worked perfectly
reviews.title: Superlative stay

reviews.text: - wired internet, very fast.
reviews.title: Love this hotel

aka: Hotel Rathaus Wein And Design Wien
description: An unusual hotel concept in Austria’s capital, Vienna. The Hotel Rathaus Vienna Wine & Design represents the Fleischhaker family’s pleasure concept with its vinophile philosophy. At every step you will be confronted by the theme of wine in the modern design hotel: the wine cheese on the breakfast buffet, the wine guglhupf with your coffee, the wine cosmetics in your room – wine is simply everywhere. Intensive dealing with a vintner is the invitation of each of these 39 tastefully furnished rooms. The individually designed double rooms are each dedicated to a top Austrian vintner, who provides noble wines for the “somewhat different” minibar.The director Conrad Schröpel and his team are happy to share the sensory experience of drinking wine with their guests. The wines of the Vintner of The Month are discussed unpretentiously in the wine lounge over glasses of wine, and knowledge of wines and vintners is exchanged in an uncomplicated manner. Tasting are also naturally organised on agreement – for individuals, interested guests and for small groups or conference participants. Austrian delicacies, prepared according to recipes by the house chef Klaus Fleischhaker, round off the hotel’s unique indulgence offer.
